Cell.Data: Entry Pathway (1)
Issue Tier 1 (Category)
Issue Tier 2 (Category)
Issue Tier 2 (Specific Question)
Answer and Documentation
New Office Customers
Licensing Information
May I install Office on multiple devices per license?

All versions of Office (except Office 365 ProPlus) allow installation on one primary licensed device. Unless the software is licensed as an Enterprise Product or on a company-wide basis, a copy may be installed on one portable device for use by the primary user of the licensed device.

Secondary portable rights are only applicable to local installation and don't apply to remote use of Office deployed on a network server. For more information, please refer to the Remote Desktop Services Volume Licensing brief.
Am I entitled to downgrade rights?

Customers who purchase Office Standard 2013 or Office Professional Plus 2013 licenses under any Volume License program may downgrade the suite and use an equivalent prior version of the licensed software.
How do I license Office for a remote (RDS, Citrix, VDI, etc.) deployment?

Office is licensed by device (except Office 365 ProPlus). Each device accessing Office that is hosted on a server requires a license. For more information, please refer to the Remote Desktop Services Volume Licensing brief.
What are the benefits of Software Assurance for Office 2013?
Customers with active Software Assurance on the product release date will be entitled to a wide range of Software Assurance Benefits, as specified in the Product List and Product Use Rights pages.
How to Buy, Pricing and Part Numbers
How to Buy
Office may be purchased from an authorized reseller.
Pricing
Please contact an authorized reseller for current pricing information and assistance with purchasing.
Part Numbers
Part numbers may be acquired through authorized resellers.
Download, Installation, Product Keys and Activation
Download Media
All Volume Licensing customers may download Office 2013 via the Volume Licensing Service Center. For additional information, please review the Fulfillment Information page.
Installation
Where do I find assistance with installing Office 2013?
Please refer to the Office 2013 Resource Kit or the custom installation page on Technet for further assisstance with Office 2013 installation.
Where do I find assistance with Deployment Planning?

Software Assurance customers may have access to Planning Services. Customers should work with their reseller to learn more about Software Assurance and review their eligibility. For online resources, please refer to the Office 2013 Resource Kit or the deployment page on TechNet.

Software Assurance customers may visit the Volume Licensing Service Center to verify and learn more about deployment planning and Software Assurance benefits.
Product Keys
Volume Licensing customers should refer to the Product Activation website or the Volume Licensing Service Center.
Activation
Please refer to the Product Activation website for activation information.
System Requirements
Please refer to TechNet for system requirements.
Existing Office Customers
Licensing Information
May I install Office on multiple devices per license?

All versions of Office (except Office 365 ProPlus) allow installation on one primary licensed device. Unless the software is licensed as an Enterprise Product or on a company-wide basis, a copy may be installed on one portable device for use by the primary user of the licensed device.

Secondary portable rights are only applicable to local installation and don't apply to remote use of Office deployed on a network server. For more information, please refer to the Remote Desktop Services Volume Licensing brief.
Am I entitled to downgrade rights?

Customers who purchase Office Standard 2013 or Office Professional Plus 2013 licenses under any Volume License program may downgrade the suite and use an equivalent prior version of the licensed software.
How do I license Office for a remote (RDS, Citrix, VDI, etc.) deployment?

Office is licensed by device (except Office 365 ProPlus). Each device accessing Office that is hosted on a server requires a license. For more information, please refer to the Remote Desktop Services Volume Licensing brief.
How to Buy, Pricing, Part Numbers and System Requirements
How to Buy
Office may be purchased from an authorized reseller.
Pricing
Please contact an authorized reseller for current pricing information and assistance with purchasing.
Part Numbers
Part numbers may be acquired through authorized resellers.
System Requirements
Please refer to TechNet for system requirements.
Software Assurance and Migrations
What are the benefits of Software Assurance for Office 2013?
Customers with active Software Assurance on the product release date will be entitled to a wide range of Software Assurance Benefits, as specified in the Product List and Product Use Rights pages.
What are the migration rights for each edition?

Office Standard 2010 customers with active Software Assurance on the release date of Office 2013 will have new version rights to Office Standard 2013.

Office Professional Plus 2010 customers with active Software Assurance on the release date of Office 2013 will have new version rights to Office Professional Plus 2013.
May I step-up my lower edition licenses to higher edition licenses?

Customers with active Software Assurance on eligible Volume License Agreements may step up from a lower edition to a higher edition of the Office Software (e.g. Standard to Professional Plus). Additional information regarding Step-Ups is located in the Product List and the Step-Up Licensing Brief.
Download, Installation, Activation and Upgrades
Download Media
All Volume Licensing customers may download Office 2013 via the Volume Licensing Service Center. For additional information, please review the Fulfillment Information page.
Installation
Where do I find assistance with installing Office 2013?
Please refer to the Office 2013 Resource Kit or the custom installation page on Technet for further assisstance with Office 2013 installation.
Where do I find assistance with deployment planning?

Software Assurance customers may have access to Planning Services. Customers should work with their reseller to learn more about Software Assurance and review their eligibility. For online resources, please refer to the Office 2013 Resource Kit or the deployment page on TechNet.

Software Assurance customers may visit the Volume Licensing Service Center to verify and learn more about deployment planning and Software Assurance benefits.
Where do I obtain product keys?
Volume licensing customers should refer to the Product Activation website or the Volume Licensing Service Center.
Activation
Please refer to the Product Activation website for further information.
Upgrades
Do I need to perform a fresh install as opposed to an in-place upgrade?
It is possible to do an in-place upgrade, however, for the best Office 2013 experience, customers should uninstall the existing Office Suite and do a fresh install.
May I upgrade from one edition to another?

Software Assurance customers may have access to Planning Services. Customers with active Software Assurance on eligible Volume Licensing Agreements may upgrade from a lower edition to a higher edition of the Office Software (e.g. Standard to Professional Plus). Additional explanation of upgrades are outlined in the Product List and the Step-Up Licenses Brief.
May I convert an evaluation edition to a full version?
Once the evaluation edition has expired, customers may obtain the full version from the Volume Licensing Service Center.
Office Editions & Offerings
Office Standard 2013
Licensing
How is Office Standard 2013 licensed?

Office Standard 2013 is licensed per device. A license is required for each device on which Office is installed (or has access to Office on a server). The primary user of an Office licensed device may also install a copy of the Office Standard Software on a portable device. Please refer to the Product Use Rights for more details.
May I install Office Standard 2013 on multiple devices per license?

All versions of Office (except Office 365 ProPlus) allow installation on one primary licensed device. Unless the software is licensed as an Enterprise Product or on a company-wide basis, a copy may be installed on one portable device for use by the primary user of the licensed device.

Secondary portable rights are only applicable to local installation and don't apply to remote use of Office deployed on a network server. For more information, please refer to the Remote Desktop Services Volume Licensing brief.
How do I buy Office Standard 2013?
Volume licenses for Office Standard 2013 may be purchased from any authorized Volume Licensing reseller. For more information, please refer to PinPoint to find an authorized reseller.
What are the benefits of Software Assurance for Office Standard 2013
The wide range of Software Assurance benefits includes Roaming Use Rights, the Home Use Program, and New Version Rights. Please refer to the Product Use Rights and Product List for more details.
Features
Which Office Applications are included with Office Standard 2013?

Office Standard 2013 includes the 2013 versions of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote and Publisher. It also provides rights to access Office Web Apps for the primary user of the licensed device.
What are the server integration features of Office Standard 2013?
Please refer to the server integration feature page for more information.
Office Professional Plus 2013
Licensing
How is Office Professional Plus 2013 licensed?

Office Professional Plus 2013 is licensed per device. A license is required for each device on which Office is installed (or has access to Office on a server). Unless the software is licensed as an Enterprise Product or on a company-wide basis, a copy may be installed on one portable device for use by the primary user of the licensed device. Please refer to the Product Use Rights for more details.
May I install Office Professional Plus 2013 on multiple devices per license?

All versions of Office (except Office 365 ProPlus) allow installation on one primary licensed device. Unless the software is licensed as an Enterprise Product or on a company-wide basis, a copy may be installed on one portable device for use by the primary user of the licensed device.

Secondary portable rights are only applicable to local installation and don't apply to remote use of Office deployed on a network server. For more information, please refer to the about Remote Desktop Services Volume Licensing brief.
How do I buy Office Professional Plus 2013?
Volume licenses for Office Professional Plus 2013 may be purchased from any authorized Volume Licensing reseller. For more information, please refer to PinPoint to find an authorized reseller.
What are the benefits of Software Assurance for Office Professional Plus 2013?
The wide range of Software Assurance benefits includes Roaming Use Rights, the Home Use Program, and New Version Rights. Please refer to the Product Use Rights and Product List for more details.
Features
Which Office Applications are included with Office Professional Plus 2013?

Office Professional Plus 2013 includes the 2013 versions of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote, Publisher, Lync, InfoPath, and Access. It also provides rights to access Office Web Apps for the primary user of the licensed device.
What are the server integration features of Office Professional Plus 2013?

Office Professional Plus 2013 includes a version of Outlook 2013 that supports advanced email folders and retention policies, also referred to as personal archiving. Please refer to the server integration feature page for more information.
Office 365 ProPlus
Product Overview

Office 365 ProPlus is a subscription version of Office offered via Office 365. Benefits include access to the latest version of Office and Office Web Apps, a complete Office experience with services integration and a familiar Office user experience.
Licensing
How is Office 365 ProPlus licensed?

The Office 365 ProPlus is licensed based on a per-user model. Each licensed user is permitted to install Office 365 ProPlus on up to five devices simultaneously. Office 365 ProPlus subscribers also have access to a wide range of applications, providing a familiar and consistent Office user experience across devices.
How do I buy Office 365 ProPlus?
Office 365 ProPlus may be purchased as an individual item, as part of a selected Office 365 suite directly through the Microsoft Online Customer Portal, or through selected Volume Licensing programs.
May I install Office 365 ProPlus on multiple devices?

Each licensed user is permitted to install Office 365 ProPlus on up to five devices simultaneously. Additionally, licensed users of Office 365 ProPlus will have commercial use rights for Office Home and Student 2013 RT on Windows RT devices. Office 365 ProPlus subscribers also have access to a wide range of applications, providing a familiar and consistent Office user experience across devices.
Features
What Office Applications are included in Office 365 ProPlus?
Office 365 ProPlus includes the 2013 versions of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote, Publisher, Lync, InfoPath, and Access.
What are the benefits of Office 365 ProPlus?

Benefits of Office 365 ProPlus include access to the latest version of Office and Office Web Apps, a complete Office experience with services integration and a familiar Office user experience across devices.
Office Home and Student 2013 RT
Product Overview

Office Home and Student 2013 RT is a version of Office that is preinstalled on Windows RT licensed devices, or available for purchase via the Windows Store.

Volume Licensing users with an Office 2013 license on their primary device, an Office 365 Pro Plus user subscription license, or the Commercial Use Rights device license may use their device with Office Home & Student 2013 RT at work for commercial use.
How to Buy the Office Multi-Language Pack (MLP)
I have an Office 2013 Suite with active Software Assurance
Office 2013 licenses purchased through a Volume Licensing agreement with active Software Assurance include the MLP.
I have an Office 2013 Suite without Software Assurance (license only)
The Office 2013 MLP may be purchased as a standalone license from an authorized Volume Licensing reseller. For more information, please refer to PinPoint to find an authorized reseller.
Office 365
Product Overview

Office 365 is a Microsoft hosted, cloud-based solution that provides Office Applications, email, file sharing, IM, conferencing, security, and much more. For more information, please visit the Office 365 website.
How to Buy
Office 365 is available for purchase directly through the Microsoft Online Customer Portal or from an authorized reseller.
Office 365 Trials
Sign up for a free 30 day trial via the Office 365 website to explore features, set up user accounts, and test drive Office 365. After 30 days, the trial may be converted into a paid subscription.
